newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Pemex appoints new head of IMP unit.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Pemex appoints new head of IMP unit.

text.p: Mexico's state-owned oil and gas company Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) appointed Gustavo Adolfo Chapela Castenares as the new director for the company's investigative arm, the Mexican Petroleum Institute (IMP), Pemex said on Thursday in a statement.

Chapela has a 20-year history working with Pemex and was former adjunct director of the National Council of Science and Technology. He holds a masters in chemical engineering from Rice University in Houston, and a doctorate in chemical engineering from the University of London.
The former IMP director, Francisco Barnes de Castro, is leaving the post after being appointed rector of the nation's largest public university, the Mexican Autonomous National University.
